term.title: monochromator

item.text: Optical device that transmits a mechanically selectable narrow band of wavelengths of electromagnetic radiation chosen from a wider range of wavelengths available at the input.

notes.item: To spatially separate the wavelengths, a monochromator can use either the phenomenon of optical dispersion in a prism, or that of diffraction using a grating.

sources.item: PAC, 2007, 79, 293. 'Glossary of terms used in photochemistry, 3rd edition (IUPAC Recommendations 2006)' on page 372 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac200779030293)
